intro: Banisteriopsis wilburii, commonly known as the Amazonian snakewood, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, dark bark and dense, aromatic wood. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by yellowish fruits that contain toxic seeds. It is often found in lowland and montane forest habitats. Due to its unique properties, it has been used by indigenous communities for various traditional purposes.
